title: Snaplasher vine

| - | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A swift and sinuous vine brought alive by a dryad's magic. It can quickly bind and entangle even a troll, dragging them back to the forest from which it surges. |

## Useful Info

**Snaplasher vines** are animated plants created by a [dryad](/Dryad "Dryad")'s [Awaken Vines](/Awaken_Vines "Awaken Vines") spell. These [tentacle](/List_of_tentacles "List of tentacles")-like vines emerge from nearby [tree](/Tree "Tree") tiles, dragging and [constricting](/Constrict "Constrict") victims in range. Up to three sets of snaplasher vines can be summoned by a dryad at once.

## Tips & Tricks

- If you need to get vines out of your way, attack the dryad - this will cause the dryad and all the vines to vanish.
- If you face hostile vines, avoid [tabbing](/Tab "Tab"); you'll usually wind up chopping at the vines rather than the dryad.

## History

- Snaplasher vines were originally intended for use in the [Enchanted Forest](/Enchanted_Forest "Enchanted Forest"). When that [branch](/Branch "Branch") failed to be released in any stable version of *Crawl*, they were still added to the game's code in [0.13](/0.13 "0.13"), but could only be encountered in-game as of [0.14](/0.14 "0.14") (when you [summon a dryad](/Summon_Forest "Summon Forest")).

Snaplasher vine

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

For a list of plant monsters, see List of plants. For a list of tentacles, see List of tentacles.

snaplasher vine w 
HP 15-32
HD 12
XP 0
Speed 13 (stationary)
AC 4
EV 7
Will 40
Attack1 0 (constrict: crush)
Attack2 14 (hit: plain)


Resistances rPois+
rDrown
rTorm
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Brainless
Uses Uses nothing
Holiness Plant
Size Large
Type plant, snaplasher vine
Flags Unbreathing
Stationary
No experience gain
No poly
A swift and sinuous vine brought alive by a dryad's magic. It can quickly bind and entangle even a troll, dragging them back to the forest from which it surges.

Useful Info

Snaplasher vines are animated plants created by a dryad's Awaken Vines spell. These tentacle-like vines emerge from nearby tree tiles, dragging and constricting victims in range. Up to three sets of snaplasher vines can be summoned by a dryad at once.

Tips & Tricks

  • If you need to get vines out of your way, attack the dryad - this will cause the dryad and all the vines to vanish.
  • If you face hostile vines, avoid tabbing; you'll usually wind up chopping at the vines rather than the dryad.

History

  • Snaplasher vines were originally intended for use in the Enchanted Forest. When that branch failed to be released in any stable version of Crawl, they were still added to the game's code in 0.13, but could only be encountered in-game as of 0.14 (when you summon a dryad).
Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Snaplasher_vine&oldid=74875"

{{version030}}
''For a list of plant monsters, see [[List of plants]]. For a list of tentacles, see [[List of tentacles]].''
{{monster info}}
==Useful Info==
'''Snaplasher vines''' are animated plants created by a [[dryad]]'s [[Awaken Vines]] spell. These [[list of tentacles|tentacle]]-like vines emerge from nearby [[tree]] tiles, dragging and [[constrict]]ing victims in range. Up to three sets of snaplasher vines can be summoned by a dryad at once.

==Tips & Tricks==
*If you need to get vines out of your way, attack the dryad - this will cause the dryad and all the vines to vanish.
*If you face hostile vines, avoid [[tab]]bing; you'll usually wind up chopping at the vines rather than the dryad.

==History==
*Snaplasher vines were originally intended for use in the [[Enchanted Forest]]. When that [[branch]] failed to be released in any stable version of ''Crawl'', they were still added to the game's code in [[0.13]], but could only be encountered in-game as of [[0.14]] (when you [[Summon Forest|summon a dryad]]).
